p: Using ArcGIS 10.0, the potential distribution in the current situation predicted by Maxent was analyzed ( Fig 4). It showed that the highly suitable regions (the presence probability was greater than or equal to 50%) for P. tenuifolia are primarily located in the north of China, including the following: West Liaoning, North and West Hebei, most of Beijing, Central and South Shanxi, the northwest corner and west of Henan, North and Central Shaanxi, East and South Gansu, Northwest Hubei, Central Shandong, and some fragmented plots in Heilongjiang, Jilin, Inner Mongolia, Ningxia, Anhui, Zhejiang, Jiangxi, Hunan, Chongqing, Sichuan, and Guizhou. The total area of this region is approximately 0.68 Ã— 10 6 km 2, which accounts for 7.07% of the total land in China.
